name: Hotel American Dinesen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: It is really good hotel with nice location.
reviews.title: Very good hotel,but could be less expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was all renovated and modern, but when i made the reservation i didnt realize i booked the dependance room.
reviews.title: good choice in dorsoduro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: These rooms are not inside the hotel, they are located right beside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Initially i didnt like it because i felt it could not be safe, but for 2 nights only i didnt bother to ask to change which would be more expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just pay attention when you book it in case you care to stay inside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location
Totally enjoyed American Dinesen Hotel
reviews.text: Two friends told us about this hotel. I couldn't find it in any other tour book. It is not in the main tourist area but quickly accessible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Even though American is in the name, it is very Venitian. Front desk staff were by and large courteous and well informed. The breakfast which is included was lovely. I'm an eggless vegetarian and the front desk staff went out of his way to find out if the bread had eggs in it. (It did not).
reviews.title: Fabulous American in Venice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a canal view with a small balcony that opened up right over the canal. The only problem was that we left our windows open and received mosquitoe bites as a result. However, by and large, they did not itch.
reviews.title: Wonderful View

likes.liked: — Young man who helped with luggage. Very nice and friendly. 10 Stars for Him!
likes.disliked: — Male desk clerk who was there on the evening of May 10 (very rude).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous little hotel on a quiet canal! The service was tops! Everything was clean and pretty - a short walk from the Vaporetto! And the breakfast was wonderful - more than just a cappucino and a roll! They couldn't do enough for us. Would certainly return!
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location - quiet canal near Accademia. Staff very helpful (chilled the wine we left for our return visit!). All rooms tasteful -Some are small but with comfortable queen size beds. Rooms overlooking the canal iare lovely (cost more of course). Good breakfast. No nightlife in this area - sometimes a relief! Lots of Americans.
reviews.title: Buzzing with acitivty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Amazing wonderful wonderful hotel. I could not be more complimentary. I have travelled alot on my time and stayed from campsites to 5stars and could not be more complimentary about this hotel. Mario (or Marco?? and Rosa) at reception was a saint and did so much to help us figure out what we were doing. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop one evening (brought our own). The rooms were clean, the staff fantastic, and access to the internet a bonus. Would absolutely stay here again. Enjoyed the trip immensely. We were safe clean and convenient to the vaporettos. Very scenic and again, thank thank you to the staff,
reviews.title: Wonderful, Wonderful Venice

likes.liked: — The man on the reception was a saint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights and enjoyed it very much. The accommodations were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Great breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Wonderful
reviews.text: Conveniently located in Academia section of Venice which is away from the hustle and bustle but still very convenient to the other popular areas. Also, located on a canal which is very convenient for water taxi drop off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Very Happy with this Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night stay in Venice at this hotel. We had a large superior double room with an excellent side canal view (Room 301). We really loved this place and its location. It was a bit further from St. Marks than we expected but still an easy 15 minute walk. There is a great affordable supermarket nearby with excellent wine prices, just ask for directions at the front desk. Breakfast was decent and included. The staff were very helpful but not overly friendly, no problem. I would reccomend the private taxi to the airport at the end of your stay, it is 95 euro but well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Venice was a very nice surprise and the hotel was too. Wide, clean, nice entrance, good and central location and nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and very nice breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Of course was expensive, as all Venice is, but really worth it, we had good reception and help from the staff and a very comfortable room.
reviews.title: great hotel in great neighborhood of venice, italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxi from the train station is around 65 euros, so if you go there, you must be prepared, searching maybe for a cheapest way of transportation.
reviews.title: Splendid Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem that we had - that is why I didn't rate this hotel as Exellent - is the quadruple room that we requested is in the 4th floor and there were not elevators! go up and down with luggage was hard... and harder if you return from a long walk for the city.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel in a great location
Convenient, comfortable, cute hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We booked directly through their website and got a pretty good rate for a canal view. In my correspondence with them, I'd requested to have a room with multiple balconies, as I'd read about these rooms on Trip Advisor. They did not disappoint. We had one on the side, where you could see the grand canal in the distance and two that faced the small canal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The people at the hotel were great. We arrived before 10 am..well before check in. They were able to accomodate us within an hour of arrival. They made reservations for us, made recommendations and were just pleasant overall.
reviews.title: A happy return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There's a computer in the lobby with complimentary web access. The rooms were pretty standard for Europe. They had air conditioning that worked very well. The breakfast room was nice and spacious. The breakfast in the morning was good to tide you over for lunch. The coffees were great! I would recommend others stay at this hotel. It was so convenient and in a great location. My only complaint would be that the beds are way too firm for our taste.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Be sure to try Ristorante San Trovasco in Dorsoduro...about 3 blocks from the hotel. It’s has a lovely courtyard and indoor seating. It was the most delicious, yet the least expensive meal of our trip.
reviews.title: clean and quiet room , nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was not our first trip to Venice, but the first stay in this hotel. They gave very clear directions to the hotel from Marco Polo airport, and it was very easy to reach the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently returned from a 12-day trip to Italy, with three nights at the Hotel American. We had the best stay of our trip here. My wife and 17-year old son agreed that this was their favorite. The Room was great, enough room for all of us and our stuff. The nieghborhood is great, it is close to the sights, but you breathe a sigh of relief when you get back to the Dorsoduro side where the activity lessens, but still provides great places to eat, fun shops and a great evening stroll along the Zattere ( with a stop at Nico's for gelato). If you need to get to the "action" a short walk or vaparetto ride. A great hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Only issue is the shower/tub combo with only a half of a shower screen. Took a lot of effort to not get water all over. Ohterwise, nothing to complain about.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with Friendly Staff

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything I disliked,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The American is an excellent hotel in the relatively quiet Siestere Dursoduro. It is in a convenient location near two vaparetto stops, Accademia and Zattere. It was easy to get Piazza San Marco, the Ghetto, Strada Nuovo, etc. and, of course, easier to to get to Dursoduro and San Polo sites from I Frari to the Salute.
reviews.title: Lovely Venice Hotel

likes.liked: — beautiful views, excellen location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Nice, clean room. Friendly and helpful staff. With special thanks to Marco, Elisabetta and the fellow on at night whose name I can not remember!!! Thanks, too, to the lady who manages the breakfast service.
reviews.title: Great Stay, excellent hotel!
Fantastic friendly hotel
reviews.text: If I visit Venice again, I will defiinately staty at the American.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel American for 3 nights and thought it was wonderful. The location was perfect - especially when arriving, it was only a 5 minute walk from the Alilaguna stop at Zattere and very easy to find. It was near the common tourists spots: San Marco and Accademia - the former was a 20min walk away which was a really pretty walk (although doing in the middle of the day meant battling with the rest of the tourist crowd!) but could also be easily reached via vaporetto from Accademia (5 min walk from the hotel) or Zattere.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely and the one I booked was a standard double room. Although it didn't have a direct view of the canal, you could see if by leaning a bit out of the window - and it was probably quieter at night being off the canal anyway! The room was beautiful, a great size and was well furnished with no signs of wear and tear. It was very clean and the staff cleaned it each day - making it look perfect each time I came back from a busy day of sightseeing. The airconditioning was bliss since the temperatures were 28-30C each day I was there. I didn't have a problem with mosquitos like some others have mentioned, but apparently I was there at the good time (according to others I've spoken with!). The TV in the room (with lots of english channels - or at least channels that could be changed to english) and free WiFi were definitely welcome!
reviews.title: Quiet location near all the main areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were welcoming - the front desk staff weren't as welcoming as I was expecting - however they did answer all of my questions and after a day or so were lovely. The breakfast staff were very efficient and the cleaners did a brilliant job.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good - I think it was pretty standard fare but gave you a good start to a busy day of walking around the city!
reviews.title: nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'd definitely come back - and as an incentive, they give a "Fidelity Card" when you check out - with 10-15% savings for your next visit - I'd use it but it wouldn't be the reason I'd come back - the real reason was because it was a great 3 star hotel that couldn't be faulted!
reviews.title: A real jewel of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a vacation in Venice, Italy, 9/7/12. We stayed at the Hotel American Dinesen for 4 days. Great location for walking to all the majors sites. This was the first time visit to Europe for my daughter and her boyfriend. I wanted to take my daughter to Italy for her birthday. The staff is wonderful they helped me plan day trips and transfers and answered any questions that we had. The hotel is a nice small family type hotel. It has a nice breakfast buffet to help you get a good start on the morning activities. When I travel to Venice I will always stay at the Hotel American Dinesen.
reviews.title: pwhalen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was the second time that I have stayed here but the first time for my daughter. This visit was as wonderful as the first time. The rooms are furnished in a traditional Venetian style (which wouldn't work in any other place in the World!) and are kept spotlessly clean. All the staff that we came across were helpful and friendly. It's in a lovely location, quiet but within easy reach of all you would come to Venice for. I can't wait to stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have been to Venice maybe 15 times in all and at all seasons - I have now stayed in this hotel for the last 5-6 times and everytime I enjoy the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ease with which you can arrive directly from the airport (waterbus stop Zattere), nice and not too expensive restaurants on the water front towards Guidecca before sundown - the calm and quiet in the evening and at night.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Perfect place to be.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location on a quiet canal, yet close to the Grand Canal. The Academia vaparetto stop was very close by. Beautiful decor in a very large "family room" located in the building next door. Breakfast was good and cappuccino was offered every morning. There is a computer in the lobby for use by hotel guests.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel American Dinesen for our first year wedding anniversary. The hotel is in a great location just off from the grand canal away from the chaos of San Marco. Easy to get to from the airport using the vaperetto service. The rooms are large with good size, clean bathroom. The breakfast is very good and the service excellent.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to a Med. cruise from Venice, we spent two nights here ... how pleased we were! Our large room had decent A/C, a clean & modern bathroom with a pretty bedroom, incl. a good bed & lovely Murano chandelier. We loved our large balcony on the second floor overlooking a small,quiet canal, a block away from the Guidecca Canal. We walked easily to the wonderful Guggenheim Art Gallery/home. Hotel is also only a few blocks from St. Mark's Square. Very good location & a lovely boutique hotel in a quiet area. The staff was very friendly & helpful. Hope to return one day!
reviews.title: Romantic, adorable, perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, away from the chaos of San Marco but close enough to be convenient. Stayed for three nights...convenient. Hotel booked us a taxi to murano and to the hotel. Rooms are large, breakfast is very good. The help at the desk is very good, helpful with directions. This was my second stay in Venice and my second stay at the hotel American....I will return to both.
reviews.title: My 2nd stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to get to from the train station via the Vaparetto service, this was a great hotel to stay in. We stayed for 3 nights and found the room was really clean, nicely furnished and the security of having a safe was great. Was hoping for a nice view from the windows but it was just into the back yard, but that wasnt a major issue as we were just using the room to sleep in, for views go outside! The staff were very helpful with any questions and even held onto our luggage for us on the last day as our flight wasn't til late afternoon. Breakfast was a vast buffet choice, don't expect too much from the coffee tho!
reviews.title: Nice refuge from the tourist laden streets of Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was very good. It was located very close to the water buses and walking distance to St. Mark's Square. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was tasty with a large selection of items. Service was prompt and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location with very comfortable lodging.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is extraordinarily well-maintained and clean. The decor is old-fashioned Venetian, but very well done and maintained. Being two blocks or so from the Accademia bridge, a couple blocks from the Guggenheim museum, it is quiet but there are some very nice restaurants in the area. Of course, the vaporetti can get you anywhere from the Accademia stop. (The hotel is on the same side of the bridge as the stop so you don't have to mount those stairs every time you come and go.) Even by Venice standards, the rooms are expensive; ours was small but perfectly adequate. Included breakfast is very good. If traveling with a group or family, see if one of the almost-next-door apartments is available. Very big and contemporary: a better deal all the way around.
reviews.title: Excellent, quiet, good location, expensive but what isn't in Venice?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was disappointing. We were shown to a room on the top floor (no elevator) that was stuffy even before the employee carried our 2 heavy bags up the stairs, leaving a cloud of sweat behind. It was also not well appointed, with dingy drapery and bedspread. But, the person at the front desk was always pleasant and helpful and the location was excellent. Breakfast buffet was adequate, but had the only bad coffee I had during the whole time in Italy.
reviews.title: Well located but disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did our research and decided to stay at this hotel for four nights. We had a wonderful time. We arrived by train, and took a water taxi here. We were given a beautiful room with a canal view. Our room had three little balconies (enough room for 2 chairs, so perfect to sit out and watch the world go by!) and was airy and bright. The staff were friendly and professional. Breakfast every morning was well-organized and had a plentiful selection. We just loved the area -- close enough to the Accademia bridge to be able to walk to the action, yet far enough away to still be quiet and largely residential. We simply loved our time in Venice -- to our right, a view of the Grand Canal, in front of us a beautiful home across the little canal, and to our left the Giudecca -- where we would walk down to the Zattere and sit watching the ferries chug by and the locals wheel their cases down to the grocery store (very handy). We are boaters, and, as such, loved the very concept of Venice. We will return, and when we do we will certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! We booked this trip as a belated 40th birthday treat and requested a good room. We were not disappointed-the room was perfect. Decorated in traditional venetian style but with all the mod cons we required (and spotlessly clean)! The view over the canal was gorgeous and the location couldn't have been better for us, being peacefully situated yet only a short walk to the many attractions of Venice.
reviews.title: The most perfect and peaceful place to stay in Venice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ornate Venetian decor is more flowery than I'd want in my house, but is certainly what I wanted for my first trip to Venice. I was disappointed no canal view rooms were available when I booked or when we checked in, but our room was fine--as well as less expensive and probably quieter--but no view, just a narrow walkway and brick wall out the window. We had plenty of canal time during our two days in Venice so ultimately we didn't feel deprived.
reviews.title: Venetian delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 104 is at the top of the stairs from the lobby (there is no elevator) so I was concerned it would be noisy. It was not. The room walls are covered in fabric and sound between rooms and from the hall was minimal. Some noise from the room above.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, modern baths with nice toiletries, but in ours, very tight space for knees between the toilet and bidet. Room safe, a minibar--but no wine in it. Got a glass from the front desk (E2.50) when we wanted to sit on the 1st floor patio one evening (no view unfortunately--located at the back of the building).
reviews.title: Just as nice as the first visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extensive continental breakfast buffet in a pretty room off the lobby with plenty of cereal, bread & pastry options, fruit, yogurt, sliced meats, cheeses and hard boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Pleasant & Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Pleasant staff. Marco at the front desk is very helpful.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet hotel. Excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is located on a pretty and quiet canal in Dorsoduro.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Attractive Decor and Attentive Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: The hotel has a pretty exterior and 'cute' public areas, so you get a good first impression..
reviews.title: A good alternative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air conditioner in the room worked great.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

likes.disliked: — The bed was a bit firm for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean.
reviews.title: Good location. good compromise

description: Superior three star Hotel in Dorsoduro, the "Art District" of Venice. The hotel is located between the Acadamy of Fine Arts (Accademia di Belle Arti) and the "Peggy Guggenhiem Collection".The House lies in front of San Vio Canal, with his private dock for taxi and gondolas. Highly requested are the superior canal view rooms with balcony, where customers can enjoy a nice view of San Vio Canal and (some of them)a partial view of the Grand Canal. Free wifi internet access in the room and also public areas.
